[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@givety/lib-ethers](./lib-ethers.md) &gt; [EthersGivetyConnectionOptionalParams](./lib-ethers.ethersgivetyconnectionoptionalparams.md) &gt; [useStore](./lib-ethers.ethersgivetyconnectionoptionalparams.usestore.md)

## EthersGivetyConnectionOptionalParams.useStore property

Create a [GivetyStore](./lib-base.givetystore.md) and expose it as the `store` property.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
readonly useStore?: EthersGivetyStoreOption;
```

## Remarks

When set to one of the available [options](./lib-ethers.ethersgivetystoreoption.md)<!-- -->, [ReadableEthersGivety.connect()](./lib-ethers.readableethersgivety.connect_1.md) will return a [ReadableEthersGivetyWithStore](./lib-ethers.readableethersgivetywithstore.md)<!-- -->, while [EthersGivety.connect()](./lib-ethers.ethersgivety.connect_1.md) will return an [EthersGivetyWithStore](./lib-ethers.ethersgivetywithstore.md)<!-- -->.

Note that the store won't start monitoring the blockchain until its [start()](./lib-base.givetystore.start.md) function is called.
